security: The text is redacted because the public disclosure of the redaction could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, and that invasion of privacy would be so substantial that it outweighs the public interest.
summary: The Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB) issued a final determination notification regarding HSCA staff payroll records, specifically addressing the postponement of Social Security numbers to protect personal privacy.
summary_one_paragraph: On December 8, 1995, the ARRB issued a final determination notification regarding HSCA staff payroll records, specifically record number 180-10071-10000, determining to postpone in part the release of Social Security numbers. This decision, premised on historical interest and absence of harm, involved redacting Social Security Numbers (SSN) to prevent unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, with 'SSN' substituted as language. The next review was scheduled for 2017, and the board review was completed on October 24, 1995.
title: Final Determination Notification
